comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Millers Point was (and is) an attractive corner of Sydney. The Google Maps street view is a very good 'now' comparison - the Pallisade Hotel replaced the hotel on the left, and the "G.BRIS" building is no more (maybe to make way for Hickson Road underneath?). Moore's Road is now Dalgety Road. The strange thing is that the buildings in the middle of this photo were replaced by a rounded building which looks even older, almost regency style. maps.google.com.au/maps?ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=Sydney+...

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: This info on the significance of the group of buildings in this street from the Australian Heritage Database may interest you beachcomberaustralia. And I echo you - Millers Point was/is a grand little place.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: This photo was recently determined to be part of the Rocks Resumption photographic survey, the title and date of the image has been changed accordingly Here is a map of the Rocks Resumption area (last one in the sequence) AB
